New Records: Willy Adames became the first primary shortstop in franchise history to hit 30 homers and record 100 RBIs in a season
Tobias Myers allowed just one run on four hits in six innings, striking out 11, a new career high
Key Match Events: Willy Adames and Gary Sánchez hit back-to-back homers in the first inning
Brice Turang reached on a bunt single
Ryan McMahon’s homer in the fourth was Colorado’s only damage off of Tobias Myers
Post-Match Reflections: Murphy said, 'I liked winning tonight, man. I love winning tonight.'
Murphy highlighted the leadership within the team
Murphy praised Willy Adames for his leadership and contributions to the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tobias Myers continued to show resilience and improvement since 2022
The Brewers snapped their three-game skid and held a 10-game lead over the Cubs in the NL Central
